arts.ttl: Millwall summer signing earns praise from boss for ‘unbelievable’ moment in win over Middlesbrough
arts.sum: “Lukas was required to make an unbelievable save at the end when the lad cuts inside – I thought it was a goal,” said Millwall head coach Neil. Alex Neil has praised Lukas Jensen for his late stop from Marcus Forss in Millwall’s 1-0 win over Middlesbrough this afternoon.

arts.ttl: The lowdown on Millwall 1 Middlesbrough 0 - Neghli winner comes at a cost as Lions surpass last season’s points total
arts.sum: Millwall recorded their fourth win in their last five Championship matches as Camiel Neghli’s second-half goal secured maximum points against Middlesbrough at The Den today. The second-half changes made by Alex Neil certainly gave the hosts something extra in their forward play.

arts.ttl: 'The difference' - Michael Carrick's verdict on Middlesbrough's defeat to Millwall - Teesside Live
arts.sum: Carrick said: “I thought the boys got themselves into good positions and had opportunities where you thought there was a big chance coming, but it just never really materialised. “I thought in the first half, we were really good, coming here and controlling things.

arts.ttl: Millwall matchwinner Camiel Neghli set to miss rest of Championship season
arts.sum: Millwall’s record signing Camiel Neghli scored his first goal since his January transfer to SE16 – the 1-0 victory over Middlesbrough fuelling hopes of claiming a play-off place – but suffered an injury which is set to end his campaign. It is disappointing for me because I have got a player injured, however, it could – if this season turns out to be a successful one – the most crucial goal that anyone has scored for Millwall in a number of years.”

arts.ttl: Millwall step up play-off bid with win over Middlesbrough
arts.sum: Camiel Neghli’s second-half goal proved decisive.

arts.ttl: 'Pretty obvious' - Michael Carrick on Middlesbrough's Millwall trip as 'magnified' claim made - Teesside Live
arts.sum: Middlesbrough quite literally head to the Lion’s Den this weekend in a game that Millwall boss Alex Neil is magnified after the two sides’ contrasting results in midweek. It meant, with just five games of the regular season remaining, Millwall are just three points behind Boro and with a real chance of still making the play-offs having seemingly come from nowhere.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough's summer Josh Coburn dilemma as Michael Carrick gives Millwall loan verdict
arts.sum: Michael Carrick admits Middlesbrough will have a decision to make on Josh Coburn this summer, with the Boro head coach happy with how the loan has gone. Coburn will be ineligible to play against Boro this weekend, meaning he ultimately has four games remaining in his season to do as much as possible to secure his future one way or the other.

arts.ttl: Potential Boro team for Millwall with telling Carrick comment and Howson call
arts.sum: Carrick’s main decisions centre around whether to keep Jonny Howson at centre-back now Rav van den Berg and Dael Fry are both fit again, and also whether to persist with Kelechi Iheanacho after he was booed by his own fans on Tuesday. There’s an argument that, given how Millwall likely play, the game is suited to Fry and Van den Berg.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough academy challenge as Carrick issues 'you need that moment' message
arts.sum: Michael Carrick insists there will always be a pathway for young players to break into the first team at Middlesbrough, but says numerous factors will determine when the right time is. Carrick has shown great pleasure in handing numerous opportunities to Boro academy players - with numerous debuts handed out in his two-and-a-half-year stay to date.

arts.ttl: Van den Berg starts again: Middlesbrough team news and predicted XI to face Millwall
arts.sum: The latest Middlesbrough team news as Michael Carrick’s side gear up to face Millwall in the Championship. The post Van den Berg starts again: Middlesbrough team news and predicted XI to face Millwall appeared first on The72 - Football League News.
